p: Human alpha-synuclein is the protein that misfolds and is thought by many to be related to the development of PD [ 11]. It is encoded by the alpha-synuclein gene ( SNCA) and is expressed in neurological tissues and extraneurological tissues such as the pancreas [ 11]. The SNCA gene is associated with glucose and insulin regulation through K-channel modulation in Î² cells of the pancreas [ 12, 13] responsible for aggregation, toxicity, and Ca 2+ binding [ 14].
